meanings.definition: The act of hunting game with dogs.
meanings.sent1: Coursing is a popular sport where dogs chase after animals.
meanings.sent2: The coursing event showcased the speed and agility of the hunting dogs.
meanings.sent3: During the coursing competition, the dogs playfully chased after the mechanical rabbit.
meanings.sent4: The coursing of the hounds through the fields was like a well-choreographed dance.
meanings.sent5: The image of coursing dogs in pursuit of their prey is etched in my memory.

meanings.definition: The act of moving swiftly in a particular direction.
meanings.sent1: The coursing of the river was swift after the heavy rain.
meanings.sent2: The coursing of the wind through the trees created a soothing sound.
meanings.sent3: The coursing of the car down the highway was exhilarating.
meanings.sent4: The coursing of thoughts through his mind kept him awake at night.
meanings.sent5: The coursing of adrenaline through her veins made her heart race.

meanings.definition: The act of directing or running through a course.
meanings.sent1: The coursing of the race cars around the track was thrilling to watch.
meanings.sent2: The coursing of the water through the irrigation system was carefully monitored.
meanings.sent3: The coursing of the students through the obstacle course was filled with laughter.
meanings.sent4: The coursing of electricity through the wires powered the entire building.
meanings.sent5: The coursing of the marathon runners through the city streets drew a large crowd.
